title: Chairman and CEO

ngos: President/Board, SFFILM; Board, SFMOMA; Board, Aperture; Board, McSweeney's; Board, UCSF Foundation; former Chairman, Smithsonian American Art Museum Board of Commissioners

name: Niello, David F
title: Vice President
notes: Vice President of The Niello Company, a family-owned luxury automobile dealership group in Sacramento, California, founded in 1955. Brother of California State Senator Roger Niello and President Rick Niello. The company operates 11 locations across Sacramento, Elk Grove, Roseville, and Rocklin areas.

name: Niello, Roger W.
employer: California State Senate / The Niello Company
title: State Senator (District 6); Co-owner and Corporate Secretary, The Niello Company
notes: Republican California State Senator representing District 6 (portions of Sacramento and Placer counties), elected 2022. Previously served three terms in the California State Assembly (2004–2010). Co-owner and corporate secretary of The Niello Company luxury auto dealership group since 1974. Born June 2, 1948; formerly a CPA.

name: Aspevig, Clyde R.
title: Landscape Painter
notes: Born 1951 on a wheat farm in Rudyard, Montana. Widely regarded as one of America's foremost representational landscape painters, specializing in the vast open landscapes of Wyoming and Montana. Studied art education at Eastern Montana College. Gold Medal winner at the National Academy of Western Art.

name: Bates, Mason
employer: Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts / Independent
title: Composer-in-Residence (former); Independent Composer
notes: Grammy Award-winning American composer (born January 23, 1977, Philadelphia) known for integrating electronic music with orchestral performance. First composer-in-residence at the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts (2015–2020). His opera The (R)evolution of Steve Jobs won the 2019 Grammy for Best Opera Recording. PhD in Composition from UC Berkeley.

name: Bohn, John A. Jr.
employer: Cleantech Law Partners / Former: Moody's Investors Service; California PUC
title: Attorney; Former President/CEO of Moody's; Former CPUC Commissioner
notes: Stanford honors graduate, Fulbright Scholar at London School of Economics, JD from Harvard. Appointed by President Reagan as U.S. Ambassador and Executive Director of the Asian Development Bank; chaired the Export-Import Bank. Served as President and CEO of Moody's Investors Service (1989–1996). Appointed CPUC Commissioner by Governor Schwarzenegger in 2005 for a six-year term.
ngos: Chairman, Center for International Private Enterprise; Director, National Endowment for Democracy; Board, SouthWest Water Company

name: Borda, Richard J.
title: Independent Banking Professional
notes: Richard J. Borda is an independent banking professional based in Carmel Highlands, California with experience at National Life Group. Limited additional public biographical information found.

name: Del Monte, Richard
employer: Allworth Financial (formerly Del Monte Group, LLC)
title: Partner Advisor / Founder (Del Monte Group)
notes: Founder and principal of Del Monte Group, an East Bay (Alamo, California) RIA managing approximately $220M in assets, which was acquired by Allworth Financial in June 2024. Holds JD, MBA, and CFP credentials. Concord Law School, Purdue University Global graduate.

name: Docker, W. F
title: Senior Of Counsel
notes: Fifth-generation Fresnan and third-generation Fresno attorney at McCormick Barstow LLP since 1977. JD cum laude and MBA from Santa Clara University (1977). Practices agricultural planning, estate planning, trust and probate administration, and business law. Past President of the Fresno Philharmonic Board of Directors (2002–2004, 2006–2008). Selected for Northern California Super Lawyers 2009–2023.
ngos: Board of Directors, Fresno Philharmonic; Board, Central California Blood Center

name: Drake, Peter M.

name: Dwight, Herbert M. Jr.
title: Founder, Chairman and CEO (retired)
notes: Co-founded Spectra-Physics in San Jose, California in 1961, the world's first commercial laser company, producing helium-neon lasers from $8,000 starting in March 1962. Served as President and CEO until his retirement in 1988. An oral history interview is preserved at the Niels Bohr Library & Archives of the American Institute of Physics.
ngos: Co-founded Pepperwood Preserve (gifted to Pepperwood Foundation, a public nonprofit); Co-founded Sonoma Scholarship Foundation with Community Foundation Sonoma County

name: Fishburne, Thomas L.
title: Founder and CEO
notes: Harvard Business School graduate who founded Marketoonist in 2010, a content marketing studio that creates business cartoons read by half a million weekly readers. Based in San Anselmo (Marin County), California. Previously Marketing VP at Method Products, Interim CMO at HotelTonight, and worked in brand management at Nestle and General Mills.

name: Hanna, John Paul
title: Partner (retired)
notes: Born July 12, 1932; died July 2025. Widely considered one of California's leading land use attorneys, based in Palo Alto. Stanford BA (1954) and JD (1959). Represented clients in over 1,200 entitlement projects totaling more than 35,000 condominium units. Board of Visitors, Stanford Law School (1983–1986). Selected in Best Lawyers and Who's Who in America.
ngos: Board of Visitors, Stanford Law School

name: Henderson, Charles

name: Hilger, Leslie G. III
employer: Unknown / State Bar of California (licensed attorney)
title: Attorney
notes: Licensed California attorney (Bar No. 219087, Leslie Guy Hilger III). The same family also includes Dr. Leslie G. Hilger, M.D., a dermatologist in Oakland, California. The attorney and the physician may be distinct individuals in the same family.

name: Hilger, Leslie Guy M.D.
employer: Affiliates in Dermatology Medical Group, Inc.
title: Dermatologist / Physician
notes: Dr. Leslie G. Hilger, M.D. is a dermatologist in Oakland, California with over 50 years of clinical experience. Received his MD from UCSF School of Medicine in 1970. Affiliated with Alameda Hospital and Alta Bates Summit Medical Center. Recipient of Compassionate Doctor Recognition (2013, 2014) and Patients' Choice Award. Speaks English, Spanish, and Russian.

name: Jewett, George F. III
title: President
notes: Great-grandson of timber magnate Frederick Weyerhaeuser through the Jewett family. Son of George Frederick Jewett Jr. (former Potlatch Corp. Vice Chairman). Resides in Hillsborough, California. Received a Bachelor of Architecture from California College of the Arts (CCA). Serves as president of the George F. Jewett Foundation and formerly served on the Architecture & Design Review Board in Hillsborough.
ngos: President, George F. Jewett Foundation; former Trustee, University of Puget Sound

name: Karlstrom, Paul J.
employer: Smithsonian Institution, Archives of American Art (retired)
title: Former West Coast Regional Director
notes: Served for approximately 30 years as West Coast Regional Director of the Smithsonian's Archives of American Art, first at the de Young Museum in San Francisco (1973–1991) and then at the Huntington Library in San Marino (1984–2005). BA in English from Stanford; MA and PhD in art history from UCLA. Prolific author, editor, and oral historian specializing in California modernist art.

name: Keller, Michael A.
title: Ida M. Green University Librarian and Director of Academic Information Resources
notes: University Librarian at Stanford since 1994 and Founder/Publisher of HighWire Press (1995–2014) and Publisher of Stanford University Press (2001–). Co-founded LOCKSS, IIIF Consortium, and HighWire Press. Previously Music Librarian at Cornell and UC Berkeley, and Associate University Librarian at Yale. Elected Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences (2010) and AAAS (2009).
ngos: Chairman, IIIF Consortium; Board, Council on Library and Information Resources; Board, Kistler-Ritso Foundation (Estonia/US); Emeritus Board, The Long Now Foundation; former Board, Hamilton College; former Board, Bibliotheca Alexandrina

name: Kennedy, David M.
title: Donald J. McLachlan Professor of History, Emeritus
notes: Distinguished American historian and Pulitzer Prize winner for 'Freedom from Fear: The American People in Depression and War, 1929–1945' (2000). Also won the Bancroft Prize for 'Birth Control in America' (1970). Former founding faculty director of the Bill Lane Center for the American West at Stanford. Distinguished Visiting Fellow at the Hoover Institution.
ngos: Trustee, California Academy of Sciences; Board, New York Historical Society; former Board, Pulitzer Prizes (Chair 2010–2011)

name: Klein, Eugene A. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Likely son of Eugene V. Klein (1921–1990), the prominent California businessman who owned the San Diego Chargers and National General Corporation. No distinct public profile found for Eugene A. Klein Jr.

name: Krebs, Robert D.
title: Former Chairman, President and CEO
notes: Veteran railroad executive who led three major Class I railroads over a 35-year career. President and CEO of BNSF after the 1995 merger of Burlington Northern and Santa Fe Railway; served as chairman 1997–2002. Also served as a director of General Motors. Inducted into the National Railroad Hall of Fame. Author of 'Riding the Rails: Inside the Business of America's Railroads' (Indiana University Press).

name: Macpherson, Kevin D.
title: Landscape Painter and Author
notes: Born 1956 near Morristown, New Jersey; moved to Taos, New Mexico in 1987. Widely recognized as one of America's most accomplished Impressionistic plein air painters. Degree in commercial art from Northern Arizona University. Author of four books on oil painting. Founding member and first president of the Plein Air Painters of America.
ngos: Founder, Art Ambassador Foundation (brings art to underprivileged children in Central America and China)

name: Norberg, Douglas E.
employer: Consultant to real estate and timber companies
title: Investor, Philanthropist, Strategic Advisor
notes: Colorado College graduate (1962). Worked at Ernst & Young in Los Angeles and served as Executive Vice President of KCET in Los Angeles. Vice Chairman of the Museum Development Authority in Seattle and a consultant to various real estate and timber companies. Trustee, Colorado College. Established the Norberg Family Foundation.
ngos: Trustee, Colorado College; Trustee, Seattle Art Museum; Board, ETC Theater (Santa Barbara); Vice Chairman, Museum Development Authority (Seattle); Norberg Family Foundation (arts, environment, community development)

name: Patterson, Robert E.
title: Managing Director
notes: Managing Director of Peninsula Ventures, a San Mateo-based early-stage venture capital firm focused on healthcare IT and bioinformatics, which he co-founded in 2000. Holds JD from Stanford Law School and BA in Physics from UCLA. Previously a partner at Squire Patton Boggs and President of the U.S. office of Thompson Clive & Partners (London-based VC). Based in Atherton, California.
ngos: Board, California State Parks Foundation; former Board, Tuck Center for Private Equity, Dartmouth; former Board, Quantum Leap Healthcare Collaborative

name: Reilly, William K.
title: Founding Partner (Aqua International Partners); Former EPA Administrator
notes: Born January 26, 1940. Yale BA, Harvard JD, Columbia MA in urban planning. EPA Administrator under President George H.W. Bush (1989–1993), leading passage of the Clean Air Act and heading the U.S. delegation to the Rio Earth Summit (1992). Formerly President of World Wildlife Fund (1985–1989) and The Conservation Foundation (1973–1989). Former director of ConocoPhillips and Royal Caribbean International. Member, American Academy of Arts and Sciences.
ngos: Chairman, World Wildlife Fund Board; President/former Chair, The Conservation Foundation; former Chair, Global Water Challenge; Chair, ClimateWorks Foundation; Board, Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS); Board, Packard Foundation; Board, Nicholas Institute for Environmental Policy Solutions, Duke University; U.S. Water Partnership

name: Reininga, John H.
title: President and Founder
notes: Founded Reininga Corporation in 1967 in San Francisco; has developed over 5 million square feet of commercial space in the western United States, primarily shopping centers. Notable projects include Paseo Nuevo in Santa Barbara (450,000 sq ft) and Corte Madera Town Center (425,000 sq ft). Past Chairman and Trustee of the International Council of Shopping Centers; Past President of California Business Properties Association.
ngos: Past Chairman, International Council of Shopping Centers; Past President, California Business Properties Association; Member, Lambda Alpha (honorary land economics society); former Member, San Francisco Bay Regional Water Quality Control Board (2001–2004)

name: Selfridge, Michael
title: Managing Director (Bessemer Trust); Former Senior EVP and Chief Banking Officer (First Republic Bank)
notes: Senior banking executive who served as Chief Banking Officer and COO of First Republic Bank until its collapse in 2023, then joined Bessemer Trust. Previously Head of U.S. Regional Banking at Silicon Valley Bank (18 years). BS in Economics from Cal Poly San Luis Obispo; MBA from University of San Francisco; graduate of Harvard Business School Advanced Management Program.

name: Thompson, Barton H. Jr.
employer: Stanford Law School / Stanford Woods Institute for the Environment
title: Robert E. Paradise Professor of Natural Resources Law; Perry L. McCarty Director (emeritus)
notes: Known as 'Buzz' Thompson, globally recognized expert in water law, natural resources law, and environmental policy. Joined Stanford Law School in 1986 after a career at O'Melveny & Myers. Former law clerk to Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist and Judge Joseph T. Sneed. Appointed Special Master by the U.S. Supreme Court in Montana v. Wyoming (2008). Former member of the EPA Science Advisory Board.
ngos: Chairman, Resources Legacy Fund and Resources Legacy Fund Foundation; California Trustee, The Nature Conservancy; Board, American Farmland Trust; Board, Sonoran Institute

name: Watts, Jack Loy II
title: General Partner
notes: Jack Loy Watts II has been a partner of The Portola Company, a private equity firm, since 1980. Based in Atherton, California. Was Chairman of manufacturing-intensive portfolio companies including Flextronics. Also associated with Portola Packaging as a General Partner.
